decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence to bring them back onto the battlefield for a devastating surprise attack. It also incorporates control elements with cards like Solitude and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Cascade mechanics to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By consistently casting spells with Cascade, the deck aims to generate card advantage and apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to control the board while steadily building towards a decisive victory. The deck's diverse mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of various colors, ensuring a consistent and powerful performance in Modern competitive play.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach along with various untap effects and card draw spells to establish a powerful combo that allows the player to repeatedly cast spells from their graveyard. By generating infinite mana with Lotus Field, untapping it with Twiddle effects and Vizier of Tumbling Sands, and casting spells like Wish to find win conditions, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a stream of powerful spells and win the game in one explosive turn. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to achieve victory.

The main concept of this Modern Mono Black Control deck is to use powerful control spells such as Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's hand and prevent them from developing their board. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Damnation to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the deck includes powerful win conditions such as Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Emrakul, the Promised End, as well as mana acceleration with Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to emerge victorious.

The deck focuses on using UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp into powerful colorless threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. With the ability to tutor for specific lands with Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map, as well as manipulate the board with Karn, the Great Creator and Oblivion Stone, the deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its high impact threats. The inclusion of cards like All Is Dust and Warping Wail further solidify its control strategy, making it a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This control deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron - Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, and Urza's Power Plant to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The deck utilizes powerful creatures and spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite, the deck can lock down the opponent's resources while establishing a strong board presence. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and win the game through attrition and overwhelming threats.

The deck focuses on using cheap, efficient threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells. It aims to apply pressure early with creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while controlling the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck also utilizes card selection with Preordain and Expressive Iteration to find the right answers at the right time. By combining aggression and disruption, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a decisive victory in the early game.

This deck focuses on utilizing a quick and efficient aggro strategy with a mix of burn spells and creature aggression. The key strategy involves using cheap creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage alongside pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Apostle's Blessing to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes card draw and graveyard recursion with Mishra's Bauble and Underworld Breach to maintain momentum. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional value and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Grief. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to maintain board control. Additionally, the deck has a mix of hand disruption, removal, and creatures to create a versatile and efficient aggressive strategy in the Modern format. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Sheoldred's Edict also adds disruption and control elements to the deck, allowing it to adapt to various matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent with fast and efficient plays. It heavily utilizes The Underworld Cookbook to generate card advantage and control the board, while also using aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of burn spells, artifact synergy, and fast mana sources like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Amber. By combining aggression, card advantage, and disruption, the deck seeks to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating value and control through artifact synergy and card advantage with Urza, Lord High Artificer as the centerpiece. It uses cards like Thopter Foundry and Esper Sentinel to disrupt the opponent's game plan while assembling powerful artifact combinations like Sword of the Meek and Nettlecyst. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and can fetch key artifacts, while the inclusion of control elements like Metallic Rebuke and Get Lost helps to protect the game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control elements and artifact synergy.
